turns.content: what does "次元を超越した" mean and imply

"次元を超越した" (jigen wo chōetsu shita) is a phrase in Japanese that literally means "transcended dimensions". It is often used to describe something or someone that has exceeded or surpassed the boundaries or limitations of their respective field or category. For example, a work of art or a person's abilities that are considered to be "out of this world" or "extraordinary" would be described as "次元を超越した".
so it doesn't need to be about dimensionality?

Correct, "次元を超越した" does not have to be specifically about dimensionality. It is a figurative phrase used to convey the idea of something or someone surpassing or exceeding the boundaries or limitations of their respective field or category. It can be used to describe a wide range of things such as a person's abilities, a work of art, technology, etc. The phrase is often used to express admiration or awe for something that is considered to be exceptional or extraordinary.
would the basic interpretation without further context be referring to dimensionality?

Without additional context, the basic interpretation of "次元を超越した" would likely be referring to dimensionality, as the phrase literally means "transcended dimensions". However, as mentioned earlier, it is often used figuratively to convey the idea of something or someone surpassing or exceeding the boundaries or limitations of their respective field or category. So, it would be understood as figurative term, and the specific meaning would depend on the context in which it is used.
what do you think the term implies in this text "天よりも高く人間界からは窺い知ることができない次元を超越した天の国神々はこの地から世界のすべてを見おろしている"

In the context of this text, the term "次元を超越した" likely implies that the gods of the "heavenly kingdom" have surpassed the limitations of the human world and have achieved a level of existence that is beyond human comprehension.
It is saying the gods are in a realm that is higher than the sky, and from this realm, they can look down and see everything in the world.
The text describes that these gods are so powerful and advanced that they are able to transcend the dimensions of the human world and are able to see and understand things that are not possible for human beings to comprehend.
so is it more likely that it's figurative here or literally saying they surpass the human worlds dimensionality?

In this text, it is more likely that the phrase "次元を超越した" is being used figuratively rather than literally referring to dimensionality. The text is describing the gods of the "heavenly kingdom" as having a level of existence that is beyond human comprehension. It is saying that they can see everything in the world, and have a view of the world that is impossible for humans to have.
It is emphasizing on their power and advanced level rather than their physical dimensionality. It is using the metaphor of transcending dimensions to convey the idea that the gods have surpassed the boundaries and limitations of the human world in every way.

Ok so the full text is: "神々がつかさどる 超自然の世界. 天よりも高く人間界からは窺い知ることができない次元を超越した天の国神々はこの地から世界のすべてを見おろしている" 

how does the full text affect your interpretation?

The full text does not change my previous interpretation significantly. It confirms that the text is describing a world that is controlled by gods, specifically a "heavenly kingdom" that is beyond the natural world and is inhabited by supernatural beings. The text emphasizes that these gods are in a realm that is higher than the sky, and from this realm, they can see everything in the world.
The phrase "次元を超越した" is used to emphasize the extraordinary nature of these gods and their realm. It is used to convey the idea that they have surpassed the limitations and boundaries of the human world in every way. They are in a realm that is beyond human comprehension, and they can see and understand things that are not possible for human beings to comprehend.
The context confirms that the text is describing a world of gods and supernatural entities, and the use of the phrase "次元を超越した" is intended to convey the idea that these gods and their realm are extraordinary and beyond human understanding.
